Project Overmorrow

A Fortnite Island experience designed and created by Charlie Ward, in collaboration with Wes Butchko and Dirty Secret.

Overmorrow will be a single-player, third-person mech shooter with 20-25 missions and ~3 hours of gameplay. The player will drop into missions set in large, open maps. Currently, development is expected to be completed by December 2024.

There are three planned mech suits: a fast, mobile suit focusing on close-range encounters and rapid dodging, a long-range flying suit that is weak up close, and a heavy-weight, fast tank suit with slow rotation requiring strategic combat planning.

Mech combat will be fast-paced and intense, with an emphasis placed on each mech's unique movement and weapon capabilities.

The player will spawn in a small hub area in first-person, with interactable UI objects providing a weapon shop/upgrade station, mission selection screen, and story/lore descriptions.

The story takes place in the Roanoke Habitable Zone in the ruins of a small, ancient trading planet. Player will have the option to side with 1 of 3 factions competing for survival, and can unlock 3 distinct story endings based on their alliance throughout the story.

Each mission will have an objective, such as escorting vehicles, destroying grunt enemies, stealing a certain item, or fighting larger boss enemies.

The story takes place in the Roanoke Habitable Zone in the ruins of a small, ancient trading planet. Player will have the option to side with 1 of 3 factions competing for survival, and can unlock 3 distinct story endings based on their alliance throughout the story.

Each mech will equip two hand weapons and one shoulder weapon. Mech combat will require fast multiple-weapon combat and cooldown management. Heavier and slower mechs will have access to more powerful and long-ranged weaponry. Enemies will include large insect grunt enemies, flying helicopters, high-damage rocket grunt units, medium-sized assault rifle robots, and large boss enemies.
